condition.description:
Multiple myeloma is a cancer that begins in plasma cells, a type of white blood cell. These cells are part of your immune system, which helps protect the body from germs and other harmful substances. In time, myeloma cells collect in the bone marrow and in the solid parts of bones.

No one knows the exact causes of multiple myeloma, but it is more common in older people and African Americans. It can run in families. Common symptoms may include

  • Bone pain, often in the back or ribs
  • Broken bones
  • Weakness or fatigue
  • Weight loss
  • Frequent infections and fevers
  • Feeling very thirsty
  • Frequent urination

Doctors diagnose multiple myeloma using lab tests, imaging tests, and a bone marrow biopsy. Your treatment depends on how advanced the disease is and whether you have symptoms. If you have no symptoms, you may not need treatment right away. If you have symptoms, you may have chemotherapy, stem cell transplantation, radiation, or targeted therapy. Targeted therapy uses substances that attack cancer cells without harming normal cells.

NIH: National Cancer Institute
condition.name: Multiple myeloma

carousel_items: Given as an intravenous infusion.
Eat normally and drink at least two glasses of liquid before your infusion.
Talk to your doctor if you develop swelling, pain, or a sore in your jaw.
Call your doctor if you develop pain in your hips, thighs or legs.
You can take acetaminophen (Tylenol) to lower fever and chills from the infusion.
If you have to have dental or oral surgery, tell your surgeon that you're taking this medication.
Drink plenty of liquids while you're on this medication.

basics.benefits_moa: Reclast is a bisphosphonate. It slows down osteoclasts, the cells that break down bone. This results in greater bone mass and lowers the possibility of fractures.
basics.bottom_line: Reclast is a first-choice treatment for osteoporosis and is available as a generic, but you have to see a doctor to get each dose.
downsides: You have to go to your doctor's office or an infusion center to get each dose by IV infusion.

downsides_processed.orig: You have to go to your doctor's office or an infusion center to get each dose by IV infusion.

upsides: You only have to take this once a year.

upsides_processed.orig: You only have to take this once a year.

userStories.tip: After IV injection had severe inflammatory reaction for 3 days, bed ridden with chills, high fever and severe muscle and bone pains

drugs.name: Reclast

carousel_items_processed.orig: Given as an intravenous infusion.
Eat normally and drink at least two glasses of liquid before your infusion.
Talk to your doctor if you develop swelling, pain, or a sore in your jaw.
Call your doctor if you develop pain in your hips, thighs or legs.
You can take acetaminophen (Tylenol) to lower fever and chills from the infusion.
If you have to have dental or oral surgery, tell your surgeon that you're taking this medication.
Drink plenty of liquids while you're on this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Pain in the bones and muscles
risks_warnings.description: People on Reclast have reported severe pain to the bones and muscles. However, this is very rare. Stop taking the medication and talk to your doctor if this happens to you.

description_processed.orig: People on Reclast have reported severe pain to the bones and muscles. However, this is very rare. Stop taking the medication and talk to your doctor if this happens to you.

risks_warnings.title: Problems in the jaw bone
risks_warnings.description: People on Reclast have reported breakdown of the jaw bone. This is rare. This can happen if you have oral or dental surgery, or if you have poor oral hygiene. If you notice pain, swelling or an infection in your jaw, talk to your doctor right away. Also, tell your surgeon that you are taking Reclast.

description_processed.orig: People on Reclast have reported breakdown of the jaw bone. This is rare. This can happen if you have oral or dental surgery, or if you have poor oral hygiene. If you notice pain, swelling or an infection in your jaw, talk to your doctor right away. Also, tell your surgeon that you are taking Reclast.

risks_warnings.title: Leg bone fractures
risks_warnings.description: People on Reclast have reported bone fractures in the legs without any known cause. This is rare. If you notice a new dull or aching pain in your hips or thighs, talk to your doctor right away.

description_processed.orig: People on Reclast have reported bone fractures in the legs without any known cause. This is rare. If you notice a new dull or aching pain in your hips or thighs, talk to your doctor right away.

risks_warnings.title: Low calcium in the blood
risks_warnings.description: People on Reclast who have been told they have low calcium in the blood need to be treated for this before they start the medication since it can make the low calcium worse. Your doctor will tell you how to treat this. If you notice muscle spasms or twitching, or numbness and tingling in your fingers, toes or around your mouth, talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: People on Reclast who have been told they have low calcium in the blood need to be treated for this before they start the medication since it can make the low calcium worse. Your doctor will tell you how to treat this. If you notice muscle spasms or twitching, or numbness and tingling in your fingers, toes or around your mouth, talk to your doctor.

carousel_items: The lowest possible dose of corticosteroids should be used to control your symptoms.
When reducing or stopping the dose, do it very slowly and follow your doctor's instructions exactly to prevent major health emergencies.
If you used Dexamethasone for a long time, you could get withdrawal symptoms like muscle pain, joint pain, and malaise.
Some people gain weight while taking Dexamethasone or can experience other side effects like mood changes.
Don't get live or live/attenuated vaccines while on this. Killed or inactivated vaccines are fine.

basics.benefits_moa: Dexamethasone is a short-acting corticosteroid. It lowers inflammation by preventing your capillaries (small blood vessels) from leaking out excess fluid and chemicals that cause swelling.
basics.bottom_line: Dexamethasone is identical to an essential hormone that humans produce and has been proven to work safely.
downsides: Can't be used on its own to treat low cortisol levels.
Since it suppresses your immune system, you're more likely to get infections.
You can't take Dexamethasone if you have a systemic fungal infection.
Shouldn't be used if you have a stomach ulcer.
Can decrease bone formation and lead to an increased risk of osteoporosis.

downsides_processed.orig: Can't be used on its own to treat low cortisol levels.
Since it suppresses your immune system, you're more likely to get infections.
You can't take Dexamethasone if you have a systemic fungal infection.
Shouldn't be used if you have a stomach ulcer.
Can decrease bone formation and lead to an increased risk of osteoporosis.

upsides: Treats a large variety of inflammatory disorders including asthma, dermatitis, drug reactions, rashes, and endocrine disorders.
Can help prevent nausea, especially when it's caused by chemotherapy.
You can get it orally or as an injection.

upsides_processed.orig: Treats a large variety of inflammatory disorders including asthma, dermatitis, drug reactions, rashes, and endocrine disorders.
Can help prevent nausea, especially when it's caused by chemotherapy.
You can get it orally or as an injection.

drugs.one_liner: Lowers inflammation and suppresses your immune system.
drugs.name: dexamethasone

off-label_indications.indication: Prevention of nausea and vomiting from chemotherapy

carousel_items_processed.orig: The lowest possible dose of corticosteroids should be used to control your symptoms.
When reducing or stopping the dose, do it very slowly and follow your doctor's instructions exactly to prevent major health emergencies.
If you used Dexamethasone for a long time, you could get withdrawal symptoms like muscle pain, joint pain, and malaise.
Some people gain weight while taking Dexamethasone or can experience other side effects like mood changes.
Don't get live or live/attenuated vaccines while on this. Killed or inactivated vaccines are fine.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression
risks_warnings.description: Adrenal suppression leading to adrenal crisis can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Dexamethasone too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your Dexamethasone dose need to be done slowly over time. Talk to your doctor before you make any changes or stop the medication.
risk_factors: Lowering dose or stopping too quickly especially after long-term treatment
Stress such as trauma, surgery or infection

description_processed.orig: Adrenal suppression leading to adrenal crisis can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Dexamethasone too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your Dexamethasone dose need to be done slowly over time. Talk to your doctor before you make any changes or stop the medication.

risks_warnings.title: Infections
risks_warnings.description: If you take Dexamethasone for a long time it can increase your risk of all types of infections, make it hard to tell if you have one, take longer to fight and be more serious. Be careful not to be in contact with anyone who has the chicken pox or measles. If you had tuberculosis (TB) in the past your doctor will need to monitor you while taking Dexamethasone. You may need to take medicine to prevent getting it or treat it if your TB comes back. Talk to your doctor before taking Dexamethasone if you haven't had vaccinations against certain viral diseases, are under stress or regularly around sick people.
risk_factors: Contact with people who have viral illness
History of bacterial or viral conditions

description_processed.orig: If you take Dexamethasone for a long time it can increase your risk of all types of infections, make it hard to tell if you have one, take longer to fight and be more serious. Be careful not to be in contact with anyone who has the chicken pox or measles. If you had tuberculosis (TB) in the past your doctor will need to monitor you while taking Dexamethasone. You may need to take medicine to prevent getting it or treat it if your TB comes back. Talk to your doctor before taking Dexamethasone if you haven't had vaccinations against certain viral diseases, are under stress or regularly around sick people.

risks_warnings.title: Kaposi's sarcoma
risks_warnings.description: It’s rare, but taking Dexamethasone for a long period of time, can increase your risk of Kaposi’s sarcoma, a type of cancer that can affect both the skin and internal organs. Your doctor will monitor you closely while you're taking Dexamethasone and if this develops, will work with you to slowly lower your dose and stop the medication.

description_processed.orig: It’s rare, but taking Dexamethasone for a long period of time, can increase your risk of Kaposi’s sarcoma, a type of cancer that can affect both the skin and internal organs. Your doctor will monitor you closely while you're taking Dexamethasone and if this develops, will work with you to slowly lower your dose and stop the medication.

risks_warnings.title: Mood and behavior changes
risks_warnings.description: Like most corticosteroid medicines, Dexamethasone may cause changes in your mood or behavior. Tell your doctor right away if you become depressed, have mood swings, trouble sleeping, irritability or anxiety, hyperactivity,  delusions or hallucinations while taking this medicine. If you need to make any changes or slowly taper your dose, talk to your doctor first.

description_processed.orig: Like most corticosteroid medicines, Dexamethasone may cause changes in your mood or behavior. Tell your doctor right away if you become depressed, have mood swings, trouble sleeping, irritability or anxiety, hyperactivity,  delusions or hallucinations while taking this medicine. If you need to make any changes or slowly taper your dose, talk to your doctor first.

risks_warnings.title: Bone effects
risks_warnings.description: Dexamethasone can thin the bones and decrease the growth rate in children. Talk to the doctor about medicine choices that won't negatively affect growth. Use the lowest possible dose to treat the condition and have the doctor monitor your child’s height during treatment.

description_processed.orig: Dexamethasone can thin the bones and decrease the growth rate in children. Talk to the doctor about medicine choices that won't negatively affect growth. Use the lowest possible dose to treat the condition and have the doctor monitor your child’s height during treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Taking Dexamethasone if you're pregnant or breast-feeding can harm your unborn baby. If you need to take a systemic corticosteroid during pregnancy, the lowest dose that will help treat your condition should be used for the shortest time, especially during your first trimester. Your doctor will let you know if there are other medicine choices that are safer (e.g. inhaled steroids for asthma).

description_processed.orig: Taking Dexamethasone if you're pregnant or breast-feeding can harm your unborn baby. If you need to take a systemic corticosteroid during pregnancy, the lowest dose that will help treat your condition should be used for the shortest time, especially during your first trimester. Your doctor will let you know if there are other medicine choices that are safer (e.g. inhaled steroids for asthma).

points.name: Congestive heart failure in susceptible patients
Aseptic necrosis of femoral and humeral heads
May supress reactions to skin tests
Burning or tingling in perineal area
Increased requirements for insulin or oral agents
Negative nitrogen balance due to protein catabolism
Weight gain
points.hlt: physical examination procedures and organ system status

points.name: Hiccups
points.hlt: lower respiratory tract signs and symptoms

carousel_items: The dose and duration on how long you need the medicine depends on your condition and response.
Take it exactly as your doctor prescribed.
Take with food to decrease stomach upset.
Can cause trouble sleeping. Take in the morning or 2-3 hours before bed if more than one dose is needed.
Can cause changes in mood, blood pressure, blood sugar, and water retention.
You should check your blood pressure and blood sugar when taking this medicine if you already have high blood pressure or diabetes.
A taper is often needed to stop the medicine, especially if you've been on it for more than 1 week.

basics.benefits_moa: Medrol is a corticosteroid that's similar to what your body naturally makes. It reduces swelling and other immune responses that can cause you pain, discomfort, or harm.
basics.bottom_line: Medrol is corticosteroid available in many forms (oral, injectable) that's great for controlling the unwanted symptoms from your immune responses and will make you feel better. There are lots of side effects but most of are tolerable or can be managed.
downsides: Lots of side effects, especially with long term use.
Short-term use can cause mood changes, trouble sleeping and increase in blood pressure, blood sugar, and possible water retention.
Long-term use can cause problems with skin, bone, eye health and put you at a higher risk for infections.
People with certain conditions will have to pay extra attention to their symptoms or may have to adjust the dose of other medicines when taking Medrol.
When using corticosteroids for more than 1 week, you will need to work with a doctor to get off the medicine slowly.

downsides_processed.orig: Lots of side effects, especially with long term use.
Short-term use can cause mood changes, trouble sleeping and increase in blood pressure, blood sugar, and possible water retention.
Long-term use can cause problems with skin, bone, eye health and put you at a higher risk for infections.
People with certain conditions will have to pay extra attention to their symptoms or may have to adjust the dose of other medicines when taking Medrol.
When using corticosteroids for more than 1 week, you will need to work with a doctor to get off the medicine slowly.

upsides: Steroid magic, can help you feel better, have more energy and get more appetite.
Useful in controlling immune responses that are causing you discomfort, and works quickly to relieve symptoms like swelling, rash, asthma attacks, gout attacks.
Useful in suppressing the immune system from causing your body harm, like many autoimmune related conditions.
Available in many different forms, including injection, that will expose the rest of your body less of the medicine.

upsides_processed.orig: Steroid magic, can help you feel better, have more energy and get more appetite.
Useful in controlling immune responses that are causing you discomfort, and works quickly to relieve symptoms like swelling, rash, asthma attacks, gout attacks.
Useful in suppressing the immune system from causing your body harm, like many autoimmune related conditions.
Available in many different forms, including injection, that will expose the rest of your body less of the medicine.

carousel_items_processed.orig: The dose and duration on how long you need the medicine depends on your condition and response.
Take it exactly as your doctor prescribed.
Take with food to decrease stomach upset.
Can cause trouble sleeping. Take in the morning or 2-3 hours before bed if more than one dose is needed.
Can cause changes in mood, blood pressure, blood sugar, and water retention.
You should check your blood pressure and blood sugar when taking this medicine if you already have high blood pressure or diabetes.
A taper is often needed to stop the medicine, especially if you've been on it for more than 1 week.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression (HPA axis suppression)
risks_warnings.description: Adrenal suppression leading to adrenal crisis can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Medrol too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your Medrol dose need to be done slowly over time. Talk to your doctor before you make any changes or stop the medication.
risk_factors: Lowering dose or stopping too quickly especially after long-term treatment
Stress such as trauma, surgery or infection

risks_warnings.title: Kaposi's sarcoma
risks_warnings.description: It’s rare, but taking Medrol for a long period of time, can increase your risk of Kaposi’s sarcoma, a type of cancer that can affect both the skin and internal organs. Your doctor will monitor you closely while you're taking Medrol and if this develops, will work with you to slowly lower your dose and stop the medication.

Your doctor will monitor you closely while you're taking Medrol and if this develops, will work with you to slowly lower your dose and stop the medication.

risks_warnings.title: Eye problems
risks_warnings.description: Medrol may cause cataracts or glaucoma, increased eye pressure and possibly eye nerve damage. You may also be more at risk for certain eye infections. Don't take if you have herpes simplex of the eye.  Let your doctor know if you have blurry vision, eye pain or any vision changes.

description_processed.orig: Medrol may cause cataracts or glaucoma, increased eye pressure and possibly eye nerve damage. You may also be more at risk for certain eye infections. Don't take if you have herpes simplex of the eye.  Let your doctor know if you have blurry vision, eye pain or any vision changes.

risks_warnings.title: Psychiatric changes
risks_warnings.description: Like most corticosteroid medicines, Medrol may cause changes in your mood or behavior. Tell your doctor right away if you become depressed, have mood swings, trouble sleeping, irritability or anxiety, hyperactivity,  delusions or hallucinations while taking this medicine. If you need to make any changes or slowly taper your dose, talk to your doctor first.

description_processed.orig: Like most corticosteroid medicines, Medrol may cause changes in your mood or behavior. Tell your doctor right away if you become depressed, have mood swings, trouble sleeping, irritability or anxiety, hyperactivity,  delusions or hallucinations while taking this medicine. If you need to make any changes or slowly taper your dose, talk to your doctor first.

risks_warnings.title: Bone effects
risks_warnings.description: Medrol can thin the bones and decrease the growth rate in children. Talk to the doctor about medicine choices that won't negatively affect growth. Use the lowest possible dose to treat the condition and have the doctor monitor your child’s height during treatment.

description_processed.orig: Medrol can thin the bones and decrease the growth rate in children. Talk to the doctor about medicine choices that won't negatively affect growth. Use the lowest possible dose to treat the condition and have the doctor monitor your child’s height during treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Taking Medrol if your pregnant or breast-feeding can harm your unborn baby. If you need to take a systemic corticosteroid during pregnancy, the lowest dose that will help treat your condition should be used for the shortest time, especially during your first trimester. Your doctor will let you know if there are other medicine choices that are safer (e.g. inhaled steroids for asthma). If you're taking Medrol to treat an autoimmune condition like rheumatoid arthritis or for antirejection treatment after a transplant, there are disease registries that you'll need to contact so make sure you talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: Taking Medrol if your pregnant or breast-feeding can harm your unborn baby. If you need to take a systemic corticosteroid during pregnancy, the lowest dose that will help treat your condition should be used for the shortest time, especially during your first trimester. Your doctor will let you know if there are other medicine choices that are safer (e.g. inhaled steroids for asthma). If you're taking Medrol to treat an autoimmune condition like rheumatoid arthritis or for antirejection treatment after a transplant, there are disease registries that you'll need to contact so make sure you talk to your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach and intestinal problems
risks_warnings.description: Taking Medrol increases the risk of injury to the lining of your stomach and intestine including irritation, tears/holes and ulcers. You should avoid alcohol/alcoholic beverages because it can worsen stomach irritation. Tell your doctor or get medical care right away if you have stomach pain, notice blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.
risk_factors: Active or history of stomach or duodenal ulcers
Taking Medrol with other medicine that can cause stomach problems

description_processed.orig: Taking Medrol increases the risk of injury to the lining of your stomach and intestine including irritation, tears/holes and ulcers. You should avoid alcohol/alcoholic beverages because it can worsen stomach irritation. Tell your doctor or get medical care right away if you have stomach pain, notice blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk for infections
risks_warnings.description: If you take Medrol for a long time it can increase your risk of all types of infections, make it hard to tell if you have one, take longer to fight and be more serious. Be careful not to be in contact with anyone who has the chicken pox or measles. If you had tuberculosis (TB) in the past your doctor will need to monitor you while taking Medrol. You may need to take medicine to prevent getting it or treat it if your TB comes back. Talk to your doctor before taking Medrol if you haven't had vaccinations against certain viral diseases, are under stress or regularly around sick people.
risk_factors: Contact with people who have viral illness
History of bacterial or viral conditions

You may need to take medicine to prevent getting it or treat it if your TB comes back. Talk to your doctor before taking Medrol if you haven't had vaccinations against certain viral diseases, are under stress or regularly around sick people.

Take it exactly as your doctor prescribed.

clock.tip: Works better if taken with a high-fat meal.

basics.benefits_moa: Prednisone is a corticosteroid that's similar to what your body naturally makes. It reduces swelling and other immune responses that can cause you pain, discomfort, or harm.
basics.bottom_line: Prednisone is a common oral corticosteroid that's great for controlling the unwanted symptoms from your immune responses and will make you feel better. There are lots of side effects but most of are tolerable or can be managed.
downsides: Lots of side effects, especially with long term use.
Short-term use can cause mood changes, trouble sleeping and increase in blood pressure, blood sugar, and possible water retention.
Long-term use can cause problems with skin, bone, eye health and put you at a higher risk for infections.
People with certain conditions will have to pay extra attention to their symptoms or may have to adjust the dose of other medicines when taking Prednisone.
When using corticosteroids for more than 1 week, you will need to work with a doctor to get off the medicine slowly.
Only available as an oral medicine so the rest of your body will be exposed to the medicine.

People with certain conditions will have to pay extra attention to their symptoms or may have to adjust the dose of other medicines when taking Prednisone.
When using corticosteroids for more than 1 week, you will need to work with a doctor to get off the medicine slowly.

userStories.tip: I have taken Prednisone on and off as low dose therapy to control Lupus and MS, but it caused a sandpaper rash all over my arms and face so doctor terminated the treatment. Weight gain was a definite issue for me.
Made my foot cramp and fall asleep. Also blurred vision!

SO SO hard to come off of...autoimmune chronic inflammatory issue--the rebound effect is vicious, and coming off prednisone makes me suicidal and want to self harm. Staying on prednisone makes me retain water and become hyper irritable.
Caused weight loss, muscle wasting and thinning of the bones
Never take on an empty stomach. Take the lowest dosage that is effective.
It has many more side effects than it's worth.. : /

userStories.identifier: Parent, work out when I can

Stress such as trauma, surgery or infection

description_processed.orig: Adrenal suppression leading to adrenal crisis can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Prednisone too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your Prednisone dose need to be done slowly over time. Talk to your doctor before you make any changes or stop the medication.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk for infections
risks_warnings.description: If you take Prednisone for a long time it can increase your risk of all types of infections, make it hard to tell if you have one, take longer to fight and be more serious. Be careful not to be in contact with anyone who has the chicken pox or measles. If you had tuberculosis (TB) in the past your doctor will need to monitor you while taking Prednisone. You may need to take medicine to prevent getting it or treat it if your TB comes back. Talk to your doctor before taking Prednisone if you haven't had vaccinations against certain viral diseases, are under stress or regularly around sick people.
risk_factors: Contact with people who have viral illness
History of bacterial or viral conditions

description_processed.orig: If you take Prednisone for a long time it can increase your risk of all types of infections, make it hard to tell if you have one, take longer to fight and be more serious. Be careful not to be in contact with anyone who has the chicken pox or measles. If you had tuberculosis (TB) in the past your doctor will need to monitor you while taking Prednisone. You may need to take medicine to prevent getting it or treat it if your TB comes back. Talk to your doctor before taking Prednisone if you haven't had vaccinations against certain viral diseases, are under stress or regularly around sick people.

risks_warnings.title: Kaposi's sarcoma
risks_warnings.description: It’s rare, but taking Prednisone for a long period of time, can increase your risk of Kaposi’s sarcoma, a type of cancer that can affect both the skin and internal organs. Your doctor will monitor you closely while you're taking Prednisone and if this develops, will work with you to slowly lower your dose and stop the medication.

description_processed.orig: It’s rare, but taking Prednisone for a long period of time, can increase your risk of Kaposi’s sarcoma, a type of cancer that can affect both the skin and internal organs. Your doctor will monitor you closely while you're taking Prednisone and if this develops, will work with you to slowly lower your dose and stop the medication.

risks_warnings.title: Eye problems
risks_warnings.description: Prednisone may cause cataracts or glaucoma, increased eye pressure and possibly eye nerve damage. You may also be more at risk for certain eye infections. Don't take if you have herpes simplex of the eye.  Let your doctor know if you have blurry vision, eye pain or any vision changes.

description_processed.orig: Prednisone may cause cataracts or glaucoma, increased eye pressure and possibly eye nerve damage. You may also be more at risk for certain eye infections. Don't take if you have herpes simplex of the eye.  Let your doctor know if you have blurry vision, eye pain or any vision changes.

risks_warnings.title: Psychiatric changes
risks_warnings.description: Like most corticosteroid medicines, Prednisone may cause changes in your mood or behavior. Tell your doctor right away if you become depressed, have mood swings, trouble sleeping, irritability or anxiety, hyperactivity,  delusions or hallucinations while taking this medicine. If you need to make any changes or slowly taper your dose, talk to your doctor first.

description_processed.orig: Like most corticosteroid medicines, Prednisone may cause changes in your mood or behavior. Tell your doctor right away if you become depressed, have mood swings, trouble sleeping, irritability or anxiety, hyperactivity,  delusions or hallucinations while taking this medicine. If you need to make any changes or slowly taper your dose, talk to your doctor first.

risks_warnings.title: Bone effects
risks_warnings.description: Prednisone can thin the bones and decrease the growth rate in children. Talk to the doctor about medicine choices that won't negatively affect growth. Use the lowest possible dose to treat the condition and have the doctor monitor your child’s height during treatment.

description_processed.orig: Prednisone can thin the bones and decrease the growth rate in children. Talk to the doctor about medicine choices that won't negatively affect growth. Use the lowest possible dose to treat the condition and have the doctor monitor your child’s height during treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Taking Prednisone if your pregnant or breast-feeding can harm your unborn baby. If you need to take a systemic corticosteroid during pregnancy, the lowest dose that will help treat your condition should be used for the shortest time, especially during your first trimester. Your doctor will let you know if there are other medicine choices that are safer (e.g. inhaled steroids for asthma). If you're taking Prednisone to treat an autoimmune condition like rheumatoid arthritis or for antirejection treatment after a transplant, there are disease registries that you'll need to contact so make sure you talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: Taking Prednisone if your pregnant or breast-feeding can harm your unborn baby. If you need to take a systemic corticosteroid during pregnancy, the lowest dose that will help treat your condition should be used for the shortest time, especially during your first trimester. Your doctor will let you know if there are other medicine choices that are safer (e.g. inhaled steroids for asthma). If you're taking Prednisone to treat an autoimmune condition like rheumatoid arthritis or for antirejection treatment after a transplant, there are disease registries that you'll need to contact so make sure you talk to your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach and intestinal problems
risks_warnings.description: Taking Prednisone increases the risk of injury to the lining of your stomach and intestine including irritation, tears/holes and ulcers. You should avoid alcohol/alcoholic beverages because it can worsen stomach irritation. Tell your doctor or get medical care right away if you have stomach pain, notice blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.
risk_factors: Active or history of stomach or duodenal ulcers
Taking Prednisone with other medicine that can cause stomach problems

points.name: Congestive heart failure in susceptible patients
Aseptic necrosis of femoral and humeral heads
Peptic ulcer with possible perforation and hemorrhage
May suppress reactions to skin tests
Negative nitrogen balance due to protein
